THE POLITICAL RESIDENT', PERSIAN GULP, li.B.M, POLITICAL AGENT, BAHRAIN, K.BJ4, POLITICAL AGENP, KUWAIT* E.B.M, POLITICO AGENT^ MUSCAT* If ,B .M* CONmiPINEIAL, BASRA. THE COMMANDER, MIDDLE EAST FORCE, U*S.N, CQMMANDERAIN ^CHiCEF* EAST INDIES* WINTER CRUISE 1952 The Cemnander-in-Ohief. East Indies does not intend to pay his normal routine visit tg the Persian Gulf in his flagship during the early months of 1952, 2 0 It is possible that he may fly personally ti Bahrain lb. April or May for discussions with local authorities a Details of any such visit will be communicated 0 < dJ (absent on duty) A 4-(89/35/50) UNCLASSIFIED British Residency, Bahrain. 23rd December, 1 950. rS ^jy\ / Will you please refer to your letter No. 41/9/1-V50 of the 12th December forwarding the draft programme of the visit of H.M.S. 'Mauritius” to Muscat. 2. We are very grateful for the trouble you have taken over this and can only regret that the visit has now been cancelled. N 1 Major P. C.L. Chauncy, Political Agent, Muscat. *

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 9/1 A IV Visit of C-in-C to Muscat'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the rear to the front.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 5, these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence giving notice of the cancellation of the visit to Muscat by the Commander-in-Chief, East Indies Station, planned for early 1951, and his intention not to visit the Persian Gulf in early 1952. The correspondence comes from the British Residency, Bahrain, and the Office of the Senior Naval Officer in the Persian Gulf, Bahrain.

name.namePart: Royal Navy, Commander-in-Chief, East Indies Station
